place.name: LLANGATWG LINGOED
place.gazetteerText: LLANGATTOCK-LLINGOED, a parish in Abergavenny district, Monmouth; on the river Trothy, 2¾ miles SE by S of Pandy r. station, and 5 ½ NE of Abergavenny. Post town, Abergavenny. Acres, 1,926. Real property, £1,644. Pop., 206. Houses, 47. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Llandaff. Valne, £144.* Patron, the Bishop of Llandaff. The church is dedicated to St. Cadocus, and is good. Charities, £6. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
